dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 7.9 cm (3 1/8 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
inscribed:
Inscribed in plate in margin around medallion: ADRIAEN VAN WESTCAPPELLE. AETAT. LVIII. Ao.1584 [in reverse]

Printed in outer margin, lower center: HGoltzius. fecit [in reverse]

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: This portrait represents a gentleman of upper-and-middle-class Netherlandish society.  Goltzius emphasizes Adriaen van Westcapelle’s straightforwardness and his contemplative nature, appropriate qualities for Haarlem’s burgomaster (mayor).

bibliography.boilertext: F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).
bibliography.citation:
F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).

, no. 219
